page.title: 02Cheriton - Church and Chapel
page.content: {RELIGION}A{church}was built before the first Domesday Book,nothing remains now but a new church took its place{ in the 14th Century dedicated to All Saints <now St.Matthew>.The sun dial dates from the 18th Century. {The Church Hay }was given to the boys of the village on the 27th April 1648 by John Harris.In Church Hay the boys of Cheriton Fitzpaine used to play games and sports.Now people live in Church Hay and its called The Hayes.But although people live there it is used for a car park now. {The chapel }is 125 years old this October.A wall started in March 1978 has 25 bricks with Sunday School pupils' initials engraved on them by Mr.Woolacott using an electric drill or chisel & hammer.They were laid by the children and this year about 30 more bricks were added.
